title: Crispy Garlic Pork
description: Crispy Garlic Pork features thinly pounded pork cutlets flash-fried to a golden, crunchy crust and finished with a fragrant garlic sauce. Bright acidity from rice vinegar and a touch of honey balance savory soy and toasted sesame for an addictive, weeknight-friendly main.

ingredients.notes: about 4 chops; if large, slice horizontally to make 4 even cutlets and lightly pound to 4-5 mm thickness
divided (use gluten-free tamari to remove gluten)

ingredients.display_name: vegetable oil (neutral high-heat oil) for frying

ingredients.notes: white and green parts separated for garnish

ingredients.display_name: neutral oil spray or additional oil
ingredients.notes: for crisping in a skillet if needed

steps.text: Prepare pork: Pat pork dry, trim fat, and if necessary slice and lightly pound to even 4-5 mm thickness; season both sides with half the salt and half the pepper.
Make garlic-ginger sauce: In a bowl combine minced garlic, minced ginger, beaten egg, half the soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and optional red pepper flakes; mix until smooth and set aside.

Dredge pork: Place cornstarch in a shallow dish. Dip each pork cutlet briefly into the garlic-egg mixture, allow excess to drip off, then press both sides into cornstarch to coat evenly; shake off excess.
Heat oil: In a large skillet or shallow pan, add oil and heat over medium-high until shimmering and a pinch of cornstarch sizzles on contact (approximate 180°C/350°F).

Fry pork in batches: Add cutlets without crowding and fry until deep golden and crisp, about 3-4 minutes per side depending on thickness; transfer to a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate. Repeat for remaining cutlets.

Reduce oil and make glaze: Pour off excess oil leaving 1 tbsp in pan. Over medium heat add reserved garlic-egg sauce and remaining soy sauce; simmer briefly 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly until glossy and slightly thickened. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Coat cutlets: Return all fried cutlets to the pan and spoon sauce over each, tossing to coat for about 1 minute so the sauce clings and caramelizes lightly.
Finish and serve: Remove from heat, drizzle with toasted sesame oil, scatter sliced green onions on top, and serve immediately with steamed rice or a salad.
